title: Plastic recycling is failing â€“ here's how the world must respond - The Conversation
summary: Recycling is not a realistic solution to the problem of plastic waste. Only 6-9% of plastic ever produced has been recycled, and only 2% is recycled in a closed loop. A more sustainable approach would be to reduce the amount of plastic produced, reuse what exists, and replace plastic with alternative materials.

title: Restaurants In Unincorporated LA County Are Now Banned From Using Plastics. What To Know About The New ... - LAist
summary: Los Angeles County's new plastics ordinance bans single-use plastic foodware and Styrofoam in unincorporated areas. The ordinance is part of a global effort to reduce plastic waste and pollution. The ordinance will be phased in over the next two years, with enforcement being a last resort.
green_innovation: TRUE, The ordinance is part of a global effort to reduce plastic waste and pollution, which is a major environmental problem.
business_innovation: FALSE, The ordinance does not describe the creation of a new product or process for a business function.
green_product: FALSE, The ordinance does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: FALSE, The ordinance does not describe a specific green process.

title: Victoria's Secret isn't keeping its 'Forever Bra' a secret - The Cool Down
summary: Victoria's Secret's Forever Bra is a sustainable innovation that addresses the problem of textile waste in the fashion industry. The bra's pads are made from plant-based materials that can be recycled into new bras, and the rest of the bra is either donated or converted into energy. The Forever Bra is an example of both green innovation and business innovation, and it is a green product and a green process.
green_innovation: TRUE, because it contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing textile waste and using recycled materials.
business_innovation: TRUE, because it is a new product that differs significantly from the company's previous bras and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, because it is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, because it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by using plant-based materials for the bra pads and converting the rest of the bra into energy.

greenwashing: FALSE, because the Forever Bra is a genuine sustainable innovation that reduces environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.

title: 12 Social Enterprise Business Ideas and Business Models - Causeartist
summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of various social enterprise business ideas that combine entrepreneurial spirit with a commitment to making a positive impact on society and the environment. These ideas encompass initiatives such as eco-friendly product manufacturing, community-supported agriculture, fair trade coffee shops, recycling and upcycling, skill training for underprivileged youth, socially responsible fashion brands, mobile healthcare clinics, renewable energy solutions, community-based tourism, socially conscious food trucks, and sustainable packaging solutions. Each of these business models demonstrates the potential for businesses to generate financial returns while simultaneously driving meaningful social and environmental change.
